item.title: Stock Market Live: Nifty Rises Over 0.20% As NTPC, Power Grid Lead; Sensex Trades Above 76,700 - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Live: Nifty Rises Over 0.20% As NTPC, Power Grid Lead; Sensex Trades Above 76,700

Publication Date: 15 Jan 2025, Source: NDTV Profit

Indian stock indices are showing positive movements today, with both Nifty and Sensex rising significantly, propelled by major stocks such as NTPC and Power Grid.

  • Nifty rose by 0.51%, reaching 23,293.65 points.
  • Sensex increased by 0.64%, hitting 76,991.05 points.
  • Broader indices like Nifty Midcap and Smallcap also advanced.
  • NTPC, Power Grid, and Trent emerged as top gainers on the Nifty.
  • HDFC Life, Mahindra & Mahindra, and Bajaj Finance were noted as top losers.
“The stock market is reacting positively with major gains across sectors.”

The trends suggest a bullish sentiment in the market, with investors optimistic about upcoming corporate earnings and overall economic stability.

item.title: YES Bank, IREDA, Paytm, MGL: Top mid-cap and small-cap stocks that MFs lapped up in December | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
YES Bank, IREDA, Paytm, MGL: Top mid-cap and small-cap stocks that MFs lapped up in December

Publication Date: December 2023 Source: Live Mint

Mutual funds (MFs) have been actively buying mid-cap and small-cap stocks, influencing market trends and offering higher potential returns with increased risk.

Key Points:

  • In December, MFs were net buyers of 60% of Nifty Midcap 100 and 53% of Nifty Smallcap 100 stocks.
  • Top purchases included Yes Bank, HUDCO, Tata Elxsi, Godrej Properties, and IREDA.
  • Yes Bank saw a 166.7% month-on-month increase in MFs' stake, totaling ₹430 crore.
  • In HUDCO, MFs increased stakes by 93%, while Tata Elxsi increased by 77.6%.
  • Signature Global and Mahanagar Gas were the top small-cap purchases, with increases between 12-40%.
  • Profits were booked in Tata Technologies and Vodafone Idea, with stakes reduced by 16% and 13%, respectively.
  • Overall, MFs recorded a net inflow of ₹41,155 crore in equity mutual funds in December, marking a near 15% increase from the previous month.

Notable Quotes or Statistics:

“Retail investors often gravitate towards mid-cap and small-cap stocks as these counters have the possibility of delivering higher returns but at the cost of higher risk.”

Conclusion:

The active buying from MFs in mid-cap and small-cap stocks signals a positive outlook despite inherent risks, with significant shifts in shareholding across key companies offering insights for retail investors.

item.title: Stock Market Live: Nifty Trades Above 23,200 As NTPC, Maruti Suzuki Lead; Sensex Rises Over 300 Points - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Live: Nifty Trades Above 23,200 As NTPC, Maruti Suzuki Lead; Sensex Rises Over 300 Points

Date: 15 Jan 2025, Source: NDTV Profit

The Nifty 50 opened higher, trading 74.40 points or 0.32% above 23,200, while the Sensex saw a gain of over 300 points, bolstered by strong performances from NTPC and Maruti Suzuki.

  • Reliance Industries, HDFC Bank, and Maruti Suzuki contribute to the Nifty 50 index.
  • HDFC AMC shares rise over 4% after positive quarterly results.
  • Adani Power and Adani Green shares continue their rally for a second consecutive day.
  • HUDCO to consider raising borrowings to Rs 55,000 crore.
  • Adani Green's operational capacity increased by 37% year-on-year.
“The Nifty 50 opened 74.40 points or 0.32% up at 23,250.45.”

This positive trend in the stock market shows resilience despite previous fluctuations, suggesting investor confidence in recovery and growth.

item.title: Neither GQG nor LIC, mutual funds played Adani bull in Q3 - The Economic Times
item.description:
Neither GQG nor LIC, mutual funds played Adani bull in Q3

Publication Date: December Quarter 2023, Source: Economic Times

During the December quarter, domestic mutual funds increased their stakes in several Adani Group stocks while foreign investors reduced their holdings amidst a bribery scandal involving the company.

  • Mutual funds increased their holdings in six Adani Group stocks.
  • Foreign investors, including GQG Partners, reduced their stakes in Adani Group stocks.
  • LIC maintained most of its positions with minor adjustments.
  • FII holdings in Adani Ports, Green Energy, Energy Solutions, and Ambuja Cements decreased significantly.
“APSEZ is poised to surpass India's maritime growth, leveraging its strategically balanced port network across the western & eastern coasts.”

The article highlights the contrasting strategies of domestic mutual funds and foreign investors in light of recent challenges facing the Adani Group, suggesting a resilience among local investors.

item.title: Mahindra XEV 7e design leaked ahead of imminent launch. Here's what to expect - HT Auto
item.description:
Mahindra XEV 7e: The Electric Avatar of XUV700

Publication Date: 15 Jan 2025, Source: Hindustan Times

The Mahindra XEV 7e is set to launch as an electric version of the popular XUV700, sharing design elements with the recently unveiled XEV 9e. This SUV promises an impressive range and modern features aimed at enhancing the driving experience.

  • Design philosophy similar to the Mahindra XEV 9e electric SUV-coupe.
  • Features like inverted L-shaped LED daytime running lights and a split LED projector headlight setup.
  • Aerodynamically designed alloy wheels.
  • Expected dual-spoke steering wheel with illuminated logo.
  • Available battery options: 59 kWh (550 km range) and 79 kWh (650 km range).
"The Mahindra XEV 7e will offer a modern tech-savvy cabin expected to include a triple-screen setup and advanced safety features."

The Mahindra XEV 7e represents a significant step in Mahindra's electric vehicle strategy, aligning with global trends towards electrification in the automotive industry.

item.title: IRFC shares surge over 3% as company emerges lowest bidder for ₹3,167 crore project in Jharkhand; all you need to know - Upstox
item.description:
IRFC Shares Surge Over 3% as Company Wins ₹3,167 Crore Project Bid

Date: January 15, 2024 | Source: PTI

Shares of Indian Railway Finance Corporation (IRFC) rose by 3.65% after being announced as the lowest bidder for a significant financing project in Jharkhand.

IRFC is set to finance ₹3,167 crore for the development of the Banhardih Coal Block, managed by a joint venture with NTPC and Jharkhand Bijli Vitran Nigam Limited.

  • IRFC shares increased by 3.65% to ₹140.50 on the NSE.
  • The company has reported a nearly 5% share growth over the past year.
  • In Q2 FY25, IRFC's net profit rose to ₹1,613 crore, an increase of 4% year-on-year.
  • The board approved an interim dividend of ₹0.80/share for the fiscal year.
“IRFC will strengthen the financial ecosystem for railway infrastructure projects,” said IRFC Chairman Manoj Kumar Dubey.

The surge in IRFC shares reflects positive investor sentiment following this significant project tender win, contributing to both the company's growth and its role in supporting Indian Railways.

item.title: Meta Layoffs: Mark Zuckerberg To Fire 3,600 'Low Performers', Says Will Hire New People - News18
item.description:
Meta Layoffs: Mark Zuckerberg To Fire 3,600 'Low Performers', Says Will Hire New People

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: Bloomberg

Meta plans to dismiss approximately 3,600 employees identified as low performers and replace them with new hires. The decision is part of a larger effort by the company to enhance performance management.

  • Approximately 5% of Meta's workforce will be affected by the layoffs.
  • Zuckerberg emphasizes the importance of moving out low-performers quickly to maintain strong talent.
  • Employees will receive generous severance upon dismissal.
  • This practice reflects a trend among major US corporations amid broader restructuring efforts.
  • The layoffs are tied to Meta's “Year of Efficiency” initiative, aimed at optimizing costs.
“I’ve decided to raise the bar on performance management and move out low-performers faster.” - Mark Zuckerberg

This decision underscores Meta's ongoing shifts in policies and operations, as the company navigates challenges in the tech sector and seeks to maintain its competitive edge.

item.title: Karnataka plans KWIN City as education hub for premium institutions, global universities - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Karnataka plans KWIN City as education hub for premium institutions, global universities

Date: January 15, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Karnataka is planning KWIN City, which will host leading global institutions and aims to set itself as an education hub. The state has offered land for the Tata IISc Medical School in this innovative city.

  • The KWIN City encompasses an area of 5,800 acres between Dabaspet and Doddaballapur.
  • It is divided into four districts: Knowledge, Health, Innovation, and Research.
  • The Tata Group has partnered with IISc to establish a medical school, committing Rs 500 crore.
  • The proposal aims to attract premium educational institutions and enhance educational infrastructure in Karnataka.
“We aim to create a modern educational ecosystem that will cater not just to local students but also to international learners,” said Karnataka's Minister MB Patil.

The initiative is expected to bolster Karnataka's reputation as a center for higher education and innovative research.

item.description:
Meta layoffs: Mark Zuckerberg announces 5% job cuts at Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

In an internal memo, CEO Mark Zuckerberg has announced a 5% reduction in workforce at Meta Platforms, affecting various departments across Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp.

  • 5% job cuts announced by Mark Zuckerberg.
  • Affects employees across Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp.
  • Internal memo provides details on the layoffs.
“We typically …”

This decision reflects the ongoing restructuring of Meta to thrive in a competitive market.

item.title: Stocks to watch, January 15: L&T Tech, HDFC Life, Bank of Maharashtra, OFSS, Shoppers Stop, Sula Vineyards, Morepen Laboratories, and more - Upstox
item.description:
Stocks to Watch on January 15

Date: January 15, 2025

Source: Upstox

The domestic equity market is expected to open flat on January 15, 2025, with key stocks including L&T Technology Services, HDFC Life, and others coming into focus as they release their quarterly earnings.

Key Points:

  • The GIFT Nifty futures were trading lower, indicating a slight dip in the opening of the NIFTY50 index.
  • 24 companies are expected to announce their Q3 FY25 earnings, including HDFC Life and L&T Technology Services.
  • Shoppers Stop reported a 41% increase in net profit due to strong festive season sales.
  • HDFC AMC's net profit rose 31% YoY to ₹641.5 crore for Q3 FY25.
  • Network18 Media reported a loss but accounting changes make comparisons difficult.
  • PSU banks may remain in focus with a ₹10,000 crore fundraising plan approved by the government.
  • Sula Vineyards reported their highest-ever Own Brands revenue in Q3 FY25.
  • Morepen Laboratories is planning to hive off its Medical Devices Business.
“Shoppers Stop posted a rise in quarterly profit on Tuesday, driven by strong demand for premium products such as watches and perfumes during the festive season.”

Overall, the market is poised for a cautious start with significant earnings reports influencing stock performance.

item.title: Meta to lay off 3,600 employees; have decided to raise the bar, says Mark Zuckerberg - The Times of India
item.description:
Meta to lay off 3,600 employees; have decided to raise the bar, says Mark Zuckerberg

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Meta has announced a significant reduction in its workforce, laying off 3,600 employees as part of an effort to improve company efficiency and focus on key priorities.

  • The layoffs are part of a broader restructuring plan initiated by CEO Mark Zuckerberg.
  • Zuckerberg emphasized the need to raise operational standards within the company.
  • This move is seen as a response to economic pressures and the need for improved performance.
  • Meta aims to streamline its operations to better align with current market demands.
“We are raising the bar on our performance and efficiency.” – Mark Zuckerberg

The workforce reduction at Meta reflects ongoing challenges in the tech industry, where companies are adapting to a rapidly changing environment.

item.title: Stocks To Watch Today: Adani Green Energy, Network 18, L&T And Hero MotoCorp - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stocks To Watch Today: Adani Green Energy, Network 18, L&T And Hero MotoCorp

Publication Date: Wednesday, January 14, 2025

Source: Bloomberg Quint

Several stocks are in focus today due to important updates regarding their financial performance and strategic developments. Here's a roundup of key stocks to watch.

  • Adani Green Energy: Commissioned a 57.2 MW wind power component at Khavda, Gujarat, increasing total operational renewable energy to 11,666.1 MW.
  • The Federal Bank: Faces a Rs. 10.5 crore penalty from the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs, planning to file an appeal.
  • Network 18 Media & Investment: Reports a net loss of Rs. 1,400 crore, with revenues down 23.3% to Rs. 1,361 crore.
  • Shoppers Stop: Reports a 42% rise in net profit to Rs. 52 crore with revenues up 11.5% to Rs. 1,379 crore.
  • Larsen & Toubro: Launched its second multi-purpose vessel for the Indian Navy.
  • Indian Railway Finance Corp: Selected as the lowest bidder for a Rs. 3,167 crore coal block project.
  • Sula Vineyards: Reports a 0.7% decline in overall revenue but growth in own brand and wine tourism revenues.
  • Hero MotoCorp: Introduced the Destini 125 scooter, priced from Rs 80,450 to Rs 90,300.
  • Premier Energies: Received orders totaling Rs. 1,460 crore for solar products.
  • Blue Dart: Launched a low-emission Integrated Operating Facility in Delhi.

Today's updates reflect significant financial shifts for several companies, shaping investor strategies.

item.title: ‘Stripper to monk’: Meet former Australian bodybuilder who lived ‘multiple lives in one life’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
An Australian Man's Journey from Stripper to Monk

Publication Date: Jan 15, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Ash Edelman, an Australian man, has shared his transformative journey from being a stripper and OnlyFans creator to becoming a monk and personal growth strategist. His story has resonated with many on social media, as he describes living multiple lives in one.

  • Edelman's path included stints as a stripper, OnlyFans creator, bodybuilder, and monk.
  • His social media presence has garnered admiration for his personal growth journey.
  • Edelman regularly shares mindfulness practices through videos on his platforms.
  • He has a YouTube channel focused on holistic practices and self-improvement.
“So inspiring to learn about your life transformation.”

His journey highlights the possibility of personal reinvention, impacting others through shared experiences.

item.title: Infosys Q3 Results Preview: All eyes on guidance revision after TCS, HCL Tech results - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Infosys Q3 Results Preview: All Eyes on Guidance Revision After TCS, HCL Tech Results

Publication Date: Jan 15, 2025
Source: CNBC-TV18

Bengaluru-based technology giant Infosys Ltd is set to announce its financial results for the October-December 2024 quarter on January 16. Analysts expect flat quarter-on-quarter revenue in US Dollar terms, with constant currency revenue growth anticipated at 0.9%.

  • Constant currency revenue growth estimated at 0.9% quarter-on-quarter.
  • Overall revenue expected to be $4,895 million or ₹41,281 crore.
  • EBIT projected at ₹8,791 crore, with margins increasing to 21.3%.
  • Profit after tax estimated to rise by 3.8% to ₹6,753 crore.
  • Current guidance for constant currency revenue growth may be revised upwards to 4%-5%.
  • Key parameters to watch include recovery in discretionary demand and wage hike timing.
“The company's current constant currency revenue growth guidance stands at 3.75%-4.5%. Analysts suggest it could be revised upwards to a range of 4%-5%.”

As Infosys prepares for its results, its stock has seen little movement in recent weeks, indicating cautious investor sentiment.

item.title: Stock market today: Trade setup for Nifty 50 to Q3 results today; 5 stocks to buy or sell on Wednesday — 15 January 2025 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stock Market Today: Trade setup for Nifty 50 to Q3 results today; 5 stocks to buy or sell on Wednesday — 15 January 2025

Publication Date: 15 January 2025 Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock markets showed signs of recovery after a previous slump, with the Nifty 50 ending higher. Analysts recommend key stocks to buy as the market responds to financial results and upcoming budget discussions.

Key Points:

  • Nifty 50 Index increased by 0.39% to 23,176.05.
  • S&P BSE index rose by 0.22%.
  • Bank Nifty surged 1.43%, while sectors like auto, metals, and energy saw gains.
  • Technicians identify resistance levels at 23,340 and 23,500 for Nifty.
  • Five stocks identified for buying opportunities amid market fluctuations.

Stocks to Buy:

  • Maruti Suzuki India Ltd - Target price: ₹12,563.
  • AU Small Finance Bank Ltd - Target price: ₹615.
  • Indus Towers Ltd - Target price: ₹360.
  • PB Fintech Ltd - Target price: ₹1,800.
  • Dixon Technologies (India) Ltd - Target price: ₹17,500.

“Policymakers will need to implement strategic measures to stimulate growth.” - Vikram Kasat, Head - Advisory, Prabhudas Lilladher

In conclusion, the stock market reflects a cautious optimism, guided by technical analysis and upcoming economic factors.

item.title: BSE shares have another 24% upside, will overcome regulatory hurdles, Nuvama says - CNBCTV18
item.description:
BSE Shares Projected to Grow 24% Amid Regulatory Changes, Says Nuvama

Publication Date: January 16, 2024

Source: CNBC TV18

Shares of the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) Ltd. are expected to grow further, with a predicted upside of 24%, according to Nuvama Institutional Equities.

  • BSE shares have increased nearly 145% in the past year.
  • Nuvama initiated coverage with a 'Buy' rating and a price target of ₹6,730.
  • Projected CAGR for revenue is 39.9% and for adjusted profit after tax (APAT) is 70.8% from FY 2024 to 2027.
  • BSE's 15% stake in CDSL is valued at ₹5,450 crore and significantly contributes to its price target.
  • Concerns include adverse regulatory changes and over-dependence on the equity index options segment.
  • Jefferies upgraded BSE shares to 'Hold' with a new price target of ₹5,250.
“We believe BSE is better equipped to face the impact of changes in market structure brought about by SEBI's November 2024 circular reforming the index derivatives market.”

BSE shares closed at ₹5,440, reflecting a 5.5% increase on Tuesday.

item.title: Accel doubles down on Sarla Aviation’s ambition to develop electric air taxis in India - TechCrunch
item.description:
Accel doubles down on Sarla Aviation's ambition to develop electric air taxis in India

Date: January 2024 | Source: TechCrunch

Sarla Aviation, launched to address India’s transportation issues, has secured $10 million in funding to develop electric air taxis. The startup aims to create a vehicle capable of carrying six passengers while offering competitive pricing compared to traditional transportation.

  • Sarla Aviation raised $10 million in a Series A1 funding round led by Accel.
  • The company plans to establish an R&D center in Bengaluru and expand its workforce significantly.
  • Its air taxi will accommodate six passengers with a payload limit of 680 kg and a range of 160 km per battery charge.
  • The startup is set to debut its prototype, named Shunya, at an upcoming industry event in January 2025.
  • Opportunities for airport transfers in Bengaluru and potential ambulance services are planned.
  • Future competition includes major players like Archer Aviation and ePlane, which are also targeting the Indian market.
“In India, a shorter range is fine, as long as you can offer it at an attractive price point,” said Adrian Schmidt, co-founder and CEO of Sarla Aviation.

The focus on indigenous production aims for 80% localization by the time commercial operations launch.

item.title: RBI looks to retain stance on rupee amid volatility - The Times of India
item.description:
RBI Looks to Stabilize Rupee Amid Market Volatility

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Financial News

The Reserve Bank of India is striving to maintain its stance on the Indian rupee in response to ongoing market fluctuations.

  • The RBI is monitoring the foreign exchange market closely.
  • Efforts are being made to prevent excessive volatility in the rupee's value.
  • The central bank aims to support the economy while addressing market pressures.
"Our goal is to ensure a stable economic environment that fosters growth," said the RBI spokesperson.

In conclusion, the RBI's proactive measures are intended to cushion the economy from external shocks and ensure a steady recovery.

item.title: ITC Hotels Shares Credited To Demat Accounts Post Allotment; Key Points For Investors - News18
item.description:
ITC Hotels Shares Credited To Demat Accounts Post Allotment; Key Points For Investors

Date: January 14, 2025

Source: News18

Shares of ITC Hotels have been credited to the Demat accounts of eligible ITC shareholders following the allotment.

  • Allotment was announced on January 11 and credited on January 13.
  • Shareholders received SMS notifications regarding the credit of shares.
  • The shares appear as a dummy ticker without value in shareholder accounts.
  • Share allotment ratio is 10:1; 125.11 crore shares allocated.
  • ITC Hotels is no longer a subsidiary of ITC Ltd as of January 11, 2025.
  • Listing on NSE and BSE expected within 60 days of NCLT approval.
“The Board of Directors of ITC Hotels Limited met on January 11, 2025...Consequently, ITC Hotels Limited has ceased to be a subsidiary of ITC Limited effective January 11, 2025.”

The transition marks a significant step for ITC Hotels, indicating its independence and upcoming market presence.
